intro: Ouratea fieldingiana var. cearensis, commonly known as the Cearense Ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
